update.description: This commit adds in the source code files for the different play modes used by gamestate. They are located under robocup3ds/states/. I included the header file for GameState to avoid compiler errors (you can ignore it). The definitions will be added later in another pull request.
update.title: jliang_gamestate_1

content.raw: I removed GetName() in ad8157189748 since name is already public
content.html: I removed GetName() in ad8157189748 since name is already public

content.raw: Yes, an agent must be on the field for the play mode timer to start. added in ad8157189748
content.html: Yes, an agent must be on the field for the play mode timer to start. added in ad8157189748

content.raw:
From the Simspark [website](http://simspark.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Play_Modes), this should help reviewing this pr:

![800px-RCSSServer3D-Play-Modes.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/A9ekGz/images/42010182-800px-RCSSServer3D-Play-Modes.png)
content.html: From the Simspark website, this should help reviewing this pr:

content.raw: Ignore the comments about double MoveBall commands, Jason just explained to me that we must move the ball to the initial position which triggered the state change and only then make the move specific to this state. I could see an alternative implementation where for example `MoveBallToCorner` would take as an argument the `initBallPos`, so we don't need to physically move the ball twice in a row, but I probably haven't thought this through very well.
content.html: Ignore the comments about double MoveBall commands, Jason just explained to me that we must move the ball to the initial position which triggered the state change and only then make the move specific to this state. I could see an alternative implementation where for example MoveBallToCorner would take as an argument the initBallPos, so we don't need to physically move the ball twice in a row, but I probably haven't thought this through very well.

content.raw: Same as a previous comment, do we need both move ball commands? Only the latter will be effective, right?
content.html: Same as a previous comment, do we need both move ball commands? Only the latter will be effective, right?

content.raw: Can you add a comment to what this block is doing? Is having at least one agent from either team an enough condition to start the game?
content.html: Can you add a comment to what this block is doing? Is having at least one agent from either team an enough condition to start the game?

content.raw: Do we need this since name is public? Should we make it private?
content.html: Do we need this since name is public? Should we make it private?

content.html:

content.html: yes, I rephrased it to one iteration

content.raw: Are these functions really const if they have an effect on the world?
content.html: Are these functions really const if they have an effect on the world?

content.raw: This is in world coordinates, right?
What is an instant? One iteration? I'm not sure if a kick for example lasts more than that...
content.html: What is an instant? One iteration? I'm not sure if a kick for example lasts more than that...

content.raw: Where is the logger created? I couldn't find it.
content.html: Where is the logger created? I couldn't find it.

content.raw: If I remember correctly, we had talked about changing the order to update perceptors first, so we get the result of 20ms of physics, and only after that apply the user's effectors, so they have 20ms to act. Or something like that. Do you remember what was decided?
content.html: If I remember correctly, we had talked about changing the order to update perceptors first, so we get the result of 20ms of physics, and only after that apply the user's effectors, so they have 20ms to act. Or something like that. Do you remember what was decided?
